programme.desc: Lamar Jackson had 3 fourth-quarter TD passes, and the Ravens stopped the Bengals on a 2-point conversion with 38 seconds remaining to hold them 35-34 on Thursday night. The Ravens rallied from a 21-7 third-quarter deficit.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rookie Andrew Luck capped a second-half comeback by throwing a 4-yard touchdown pass to Reggie Wayne with 35 seconds to go that gave Indianapolis a stunning 30-27 victory over Green Bay on Sunday in the Colts' first game without coach Chuck Pagano.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Matt Ryan threw for 291 yards, rookie Julio Jones caught 11 passes for 127 yards, and the Atlanta Falcons held off a second-half rally from Seattle for a 30-28 win over the Seahawks.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Running back Ezekiel Elliott continues to dominate, as he wins the game for the Dallas Cowboys in their Week 10 matchup against the Pittsburgh Steelers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The New England Patriots stormed back from a 24-0 halftime deficit to beat the Denver Broncos 34-31 in a contest that finished early Monday morning and deep into overtime. It was the biggest comeback of Brady's career.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rob Bironas kicked a 26-yard field goal in overtime, and the Titans stopped backup quarterback Shaun Hill on fourth down to finally pull out a 44-41 win over the Detroit Lions.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: DeSean Jackson scored on a 65-yard punt return on the final play of the game and the Philadelphia Eagles scored 28 points in the final 7:28 to stun the New York Giants 38-31 Sunday and take over first place in the NFC East.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Vikings completed the biggest comeback in NFL history, erasing a 33-point deficit by beating the Colts 39-36 on Greg Joseph's 40-yard field goal with three seconds left in overtime to win NFC North division.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rookie Justin Herbert scored on a 1-yard plunge to give the Los Angeles Chargers a 30-27 overtime victory over the Las Vegas Raiders on Thursday night.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jonathan Taylor scores five TDs in one game, Colts beat Bills 41-15 during Week 11 of the 2021 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley sets Eagles franchise record with 255 yards rushing, 2 TDs in a 37-20 win over Rams.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Alvin Kamara's 6 TDs tie the NFL record and New Orleans Saints beat the Minnesota Vikings, 52-33.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Atlanta Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan shredded Carolina's defense, passing for a team-record 503 yards and four touchdowns, wide receiver Julio Jones had 12 receptions for a Falcons-record 300 yards, and Atlanta beat the struggling Panthers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Stafford passed for 320 yards and hit Puka Nacua for a 19-yard touchdown with 1:54 to play, and the Rams overcame Allen's three TD passes and three TD runs to snap the Bills' seven-game winning streak with a 44-42 victory Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the Week 8, 2015 matchup between the New Orleans Saints and the New York Giants where Drew Brees passed for 505 yards and an NFL record-tying seven touchdowns, and recently signed Kai Forbath kicked a 50-yard field goal as time ran out, giving the Saints a 52-49 victory in a game with a record 13 scoring passes.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Mikita Badziakouski holds the chip lead ahead of Ali Imsirovic, Daniel Negreanu, Jason Koon, and Seth Davies in Event 10. There is $342,000 awaiting the eventual winner, while Negreanu is eyeing the Poker Masters Purple Jacket.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: A massive $680,000 first-place prize awaits the winner in Event #11 as Australian Michael Addamo holds the chip lead. Trailing Addamo are Jason Koon, David Coleman, Cary Katz, and Alex Foxen who are all looking to grab their first Poker Masters title of the year.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The champion returns as the chip leader as Michael Addamo is eyeing back-to-back victories and the Poker Masters Purple Jacket. The final five players also include Nick Petrangelo, Stanley Tang, Alex Foxen, and Mikita Badziakouski as $1,160,000 awaits the Event #12 winner.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 50 players return on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event as Marcel Luske headlines the feature table along with John Murphy. On the outer tables, Josh Arieh and David Williams begin their run up the leaderboard, while previous champions Chris Ferguson and Dan Harrington remain in contention as just 32 players remain.

programme.title: Thick Trip
programme.desc: Four close-knit friends, all single and yearning for a change, embark on a summer-long 'Queen's Trip' to South Padre, Houston, and the untouched wilderness. As they travel and experience the vibrant cultures and breathtaking landscapes, they confront their fears, rediscover their passions, and explore their own wild sides.

programme.title: Treasure Box
programme.desc: Treasure is Daddy's main girl that holds the house and the other girls down.

programme.title: Unfinished Business
programme.desc: After losing his brother, a local sheriff is on a desperate hunt for vengeance. But a revelation about his past makes him and his daughter targets.

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: Shortly after moving to a poor neighborhood in New York City, Victoria's drug-dealing father is killed by local competition. Victoria goes looking for answers, justice and revenge but loses herself along the way.

programme.title: Water
programme.desc: Well-known rapper Poetic Rhymes goes to jail after a misunderstanding at a bar. He encounters an unusual cell mate that takes control of his mind. After being released from prison, his family notices the changes the hard way.

programme.title: Women of the Jury
programme.desc: On trial for murder, a man's fate hangs in the balance as twelve women jurors argue his case. One juror remains uncertain of the man's guilt.

programme.title: What She Wants
programme.desc: Vannaleese Poole is a street smart, businesswoman who uses her talents to get what she wants. In her quest for power, she falls for two men and becomes embroiled in a web of jealous and deceit.

programme.title: American Girl
programme.desc: A young woman with political and social-justice aspirations finds herself trying to survive on the streets of Atlanta after running away from home.

programme.title: Battered Emotions
programme.desc: Grappling with a breast cancer diagnosis, Rasheada fights to stay strong while her sister and best friend face their own personal battles.

programme.title: Battered Emotions 2
programme.desc: A pregnant woman makes the decision to leave her abusive boyfriend after an act of violence proves to be the last straw for their relationship.

programme.title: Unsecured
programme.desc: Bobby, haunted by the infidelity of his ex-wife, enters a new relationship with Lakeisha while grappling with deep-seated insecurities. Unbeknownst to Lakeisha, his past resurfaces when a witness claims to have seen him involved in a murder.

programme.title: Dreamer on Dreamer 2
programme.desc: Derrick attempts to break it off with his side-chick Keisha, but she thought she was his one and only. That is until she finds out about his fiancé Crystal. To get revenge, Keisha decides to befriend Crystal.

programme.title: Droppin Bodies
programme.desc: Julia, a mother haunted by a violent past, flees her old life to protect her daughter, Kelsey. But when Kelsey is tragically murdered by her boyfriend, Julia is left shattered and betrayed. Abandoned by a justice system that fails to bring her daughter's killer to account, she's forced to confront the darkness she once escaped.

programme.title: The Good Sister
programme.desc: Raven moves in with her sister Devin and her husband in Atlanta, where she begins to dig her claws into Devin's life and home, and seducing her husband. Devin must make a choice that could be deadly to save her own life and happiness.

programme.title: Teacher's Pet
programme.desc: A young man and his teacher enter into an inappropriate relationship with deadly consequences.

programme.title: The Struggle
programme.desc: A young husband's descent into alcoholism threatens his marriage.

programme.title: The Struggle 2: The Dilemma
programme.desc: Darnell gets released from jail and tries to take back control of his territory.

programme.title: Rackades
programme.desc: Three friends are thriving in a life of scamming and finessing. But one day they cross the wrong person and everything takes a turn.

programme.title: Never Too Far Away
programme.desc: Cierra Flowers, an exotic dancer with a sordid and complicated past, moves to a small town where she meets a man who is already involved.

programme.title: Office Secrets
programme.desc: As Alvin climbs to the top, he uncovers Mr. Leonard's dark secrets, setting off a chain reaction of suspense. Meanwhile, Victoria's vendetta adds a spicy twist to the mix, creating a captivating story where love, revenge, and corporate chaos collide in the most unexpected ways.

programme.title: Intrigue
programme.desc: Jessica and Darren's marriage has hit a rocky stage in their lives. When a mysterious man named Michael enters her life, Jessica is intrigued explores options that could have deadly consequences.

programme.title: Gutter
programme.desc: A young man who was raised in a chaotic lifestyle realizes that to get ahead in this world, he must not deny the streets that made him.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Derek Dirt Roberts is the top lieutenant for Big Boss, a criminal mastermind who becomes the city's most powerful organized criminal. When the two grow apart, Dirt hatches an elaborate plan to leave the organization.

programme.title: The Perfect Challenge
programme.desc: Alfred and Della Hughes, a successful couple, face marital strife. Alfred's neglect and an affair strain their bond. Della, overwhelmed by household duties, feels undervalued. Their children witness their parents' escalating conflicts, leading to a tumultuous breakdown. Though their children plead for unity, divorce looms. A family intervention, sparked by a heartfelt gift, forces them to confront their deep-seated love and the possibility of reconciliation.

programme.title: Priceless: The Dawn

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.desc: The team is invited to Hawaii for a week to oversee new lifeguard techniques and relax a bit.

programme.desc: After Matt is stung by a poisonous fish they find a village where a young woman offers to help.

programme.desc: Kaye is reunited with old flame Wes Masters. Stephanie undergoes surgery for melanoma.

programme.desc: Australia's Uncle Toby's International Ironman Competition sparks a battle of the sexes.

programme.desc: Fire chief Captain Huntingdon and the Baywatch team form an elite joint Search and Rescue unit.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 24 junior home cooks in America arrive in the MASTERCHEF kitchen and are immediately put to the test to prove they can master any challenge thrown their way – from elevating classic breakfast and lunch dishes, to mystery box challenges, to making as many perfect banana splits as possible. These chef-testants begin to learn the importance of teamwork and speed in the kitchen, while facing two sets of eliminations.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The 22 remaining junior home cooks are divided into teams of four and face a speed and teamwork challenge to make as many perfect banana splits as possible! Not only is an elimination on the line, but the winning team gets to turn a judge into a human banana split.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: A Denver restaurant owner maintains that his pizza is the best in the city, but local residents actually prefer store-bought pies.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The contestants have forty minutes to cook a steak and two sides. The winner dines at Beverly Hills’ CUT while the losers clean the truck and motorbikes used to drive to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: On the USS Iowa, the final two chefs must create three main entrées, one cold appetizer and one hot appetizer. The winner gets first pick in creating a team from eliminated chefs.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the season’s first big team challenge, the top 20 junior home cooks test their leadership and communication skills in a bold carnival-themed competition. As two teams of nine fuel 51 Circus Vargas performers with a delicious lunch, one team prepares seared salmon and the other grills NY strip steak. With at least two contestants on the chopping block, the home cooks must rise to the occasion in a birthday cake pressure challenge to prove their rightful spot.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The pressure is on for the remaining 18 young home cooks, who must debone an entire fish and make a MASTERCHEF worthy dish, or be at risk in a challenge. Not only are there big stakes at hand – the winner will receive a special advantage worthy of the effort – but the cooks also bring heart to the table as they reveal how their cultural heritages influence their cooking styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the bank holiday ahead there's plenty of opportunity to catch up with some essential jobs in the garden and Monty gives a masterclass on how to look after and prune soft fruit to ensure maximum production next year. Frances Tophill is at RHS Rosemoor where she is catching up on her vegetable trials which she started earlier in the year, and Alan Power visits Hestercombe Gardens in Somerset to find out more about the discovery of a long lost gladiolus.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the regular team are joined by some new faces offering tips, advice and inspiration from gardens large and small across the country. In this programme Monty is at Longmeadow catching up with some seasonal jobs, and also getting out and about for an inspiring visit to the longest herbaceous border in the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow giving advice on how to deal with unruly roses, taking cuttings of herbs and planting a new tree. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families, exploring some of the most popular relations of the rose and we pay a visit to an orchard in Worcestershire to find out how enthusiasts are caring for one of the rose family members - the plum.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: September is the perfect time for planting and Monty adds some autumn flowering asters to his borders as well as refreshing his strawberry beds with new stock. Carol Klein continues her series on plant families and this week she takes a close look at one of the largest plant families in the world, the daisy family, and we pay a visit to a plant nursery in Hampshire, which specialises in growing plants - including many varieties of daisy - for attracting wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty Don helps six different families realise their dream of returning to the land. They're all determined to leave the rat race behind and transform their lives. With over forty years' experience of farming, Monty Don is on hand to guide the novices through their first, tentative steps. The first episode features Dick and Pauline Beijen, who gave up their executive lifestyle and moved from Dick's native Holland to Devon.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Having tires of their stressful city life, Rob and Sue Wood moved from the London suburbs to a windswept corner of Cornwall to pursue Rob's dream of living a more self-sufficient life. While renting a tiny smallholding costing them a whopping £1,200 a month, they hope to earn their living from the land. However, if that wasn't challenge enough, Sue is heavily pregnant with two young children already to care for.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty meets Karon and Simon, who have grand plans to rear rare-breed pigs in Suffolk.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There's plenty of advice from Longmeadow this week, as Monty starts to tidy up the garden for autumn and reviews this year's display in the jewel garden. In the final part of Carol Klein's series on plant families she looks at the Apiaceae family, which includes not only stalwart and wild-life friendly plants but also edible roots; and we pay a visit to a giant vegetable grower in Nottinghamshire who is hoping to break the world record with his carrots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with seasonal jobs at Longmeadow when he divides some perennials and plants alpines for spring colour. He also travels to Dublin to meet Helen Dillon to find out why she is planning to leave her world famous garden after decades of honing it to perfection. In Scotland, Joe Swift begins his quest to find out why we should rekindle our love for rock gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After months of nurturing the plants in his garden, Monty reaps a harvest of a different kind when he investigates how productive his bees have been at making honey. Joe Swift visits the world famous Chatsworth House in Derbyshire to explore the history of its monumental 19th-century rock garden and to see how a more contemporary version compliments the original design.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There is a visitor at Longmeadow this week, when Rachel de Thame lends Monty a hand as he refreshes his dry garden with plants that will thrive in tricky growing conditions. Monty also visits a national collection of vines.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty kicks off the gardening year from Longmeadow as he shares his tips for pruning, planting up pots for spring colour and sharing his plans for the year. At Packwood House, the extraordinary herbaceous borders come under Adam Frost's scrutiny.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is mulching the borders in preparation for spring and potting up his dahlias for the year ahead. Carol Klein celebrates her plant of the month, and Frances Tophill is at the Andromeda Botanic Gardens in Barbados.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts his plans for his revamped courtyard garden when he plants bare root trees. Also, Nick Bailey explores the strange world of lichens and finds out how these plants grow and thrive on trees, wood and stone.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins a new project when he starts a new soft fruit garden. He also plants new potatoes and divides herbaceous plants in the jewel garden. Also, Frances visits an extraordinary garden in Barbados which was developed from a collapsed cave.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and Carol Klein go behind the scenes at the Malvern Spring Gardening Show. While Monty takes a sneak peak at the floral marquee before the show opens, Carol hunts for rare and unusual plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits Kierti Vaidya's alpaca farm in Warwickshire that has run into difficulties.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits Nick and Talitha, who hope to make a new life for themselves from two acres of land.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits city girl Jen and her country cousin Bek who have started a flower farm in Kent.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives his advice on the best apples and pears to grow in small spaces when he begins to plant up his new fruit garden and gets on with planning for colour when he plants summer flowering bulbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Nick Bailey gets to grips with an unpromising patch of grass, and gives his tips on how to achieve a luscious lawn. We return to Adam Frost's garden as he starts to transform a herbaceous border and gives his advice on how to get rid of bindweed.

programme.title: Storytellers

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel of All Things Hunting Scout, Prepare and Execute a late season duck hunt in a Cypress Break in the State of Louisiana. A successful duck hunt takes three things to accomplish, Great Gear, Hard Work, Finding where the ducks want to be, and this hunt has them all.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Aoudad Country Part 2- Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things hunting head to the Texas and Mexico border on a DIY Aoudad hunt where Cole is after his first Aoudad. After that Kyle teams up with good friend Chris Griffin where they head to another Ranch on the border and hunt two giant Aoudad rams with a rifles.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting head to the Rocky Mountains with Browning Rifles in hand after “Wapiti” the Native American Term meaning “White Rump” referring to Elk.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: It's Rifle Season in Oklahoma. Kyle Barefield and wife, Stevie Barefield are hunting the rut for big western bucks with the brand new X-Bolt 2 Rifle from Browning. A front blows in, and with the change in weather, 2 big whitetails go down.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel are on a week long mission to find the ducks in the central flyway. The weather is starting to push the ducksdown in to TX and OK but the heavy rainfall has spread them out. It takes constant scouting and adapting to the changes each day to stay on the ducks in order to shoot limits.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: The mission of Shoot United is to be a content resource for millions of shooters and a place where people can learn, build confidence and find ways to participate. Through films, educational videos and articles, SU has impacted countless shooters all over the world. In this episode, join Shoot United Ambassadors as they inspire and educate through a series of instructional videos and stories in pistol, self-defense, trap and skeet and sporting clays. GUESTS: Thea Van Sync (Team Winchester) Callie Farill (Team Winchester) Becky Yackley (Team Winchester) Theo Ribbs (Team Winchester) Jessica Hook (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John meets with the experts at Marine Surplus to select proper fiberglass materials for his classic 200 Aquasport project, then back at SSTV HQ, John and Bert tackle raising the transom to 25”.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel of All Things Hunting Scout, Prepare and Execute a late season duck hunt in a Cypress Break in the State of Louisiana. A successful duck hunt takes three things to accomplish, Great Gear, Hard Work, Finding where the ducks want to be, and this hunt has them all.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Aoudad Country Part 2- Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things hunting head to the Texas and Mexico border on a DIY Aoudad hunt where Cole is after his first Aoudad. programme.title: Browning Films

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: It's Rifle Season in Oklahoma. Kyle Barefield and wife, Stevie Barefield are hunting the rut for big western bucks with the brand new X-Bolt 2 Rifle from Browning. A front blows in, and with the change in weather, 2 big whitetails go down.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel are on a week long mission to find the ducks in the central flyway. The weather is starting to push the ducksdown in to TX and OK but the heavy rainfall has spread them out. It takes constant scouting and adapting to the changes each day to stay on the ducks in order to shoot limits.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: The mission of Shoot United is to be a content resource for millions of shooters and a place where people can learn, build confidence and find ways to participate. Through films, educational videos and articles, SU has impacted countless shooters all over the world. In this episode, join Shoot United Ambassadors as they inspire and educate through a series of instructional videos and stories in pistol, self-defense, trap and skeet and sporting clays. GUESTS: Thea Van Sync (Team Winchester) Callie Farill (Team Winchester) Becky Yackley (Team Winchester) Theo Ribbs (Team Winchester) Jessica Hook (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Storytellers

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Air

programme.title: Alice in Wonderland

programme.title: The Last Dragonslayer

programme.title: Life Without Dick
programme.desc: After shooting her boyfriend, she meets the hitman who had been planning to kill him. As the two dispose of his body, romantic sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: Just One of the Guys
programme.desc: Convinced that she is not being taken seriously because of her looks, a pretty teenage girl enrolls in a new high school disguised as a boy.

programme.title: Immediate Family
programme.desc: An upscale couple unable to conceive arrange a brokered adoption with a pregnant woman who doesn’t hold up her end of the deal to give up the baby.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: The Jane Austen classic portrays two sisters, one pragmatic, the other overly emotional, who both fall in love with men who are promised to others.

programme.title: Affair in Trinidad
programme.desc: At the cost of damaging her relationship, a club dancer secretly works in cahoots with the cops to extract intel from a gang of international spies.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: 711 Ocean Drive
programme.desc: A phone company repairman bites off more than he can chew when he agrees to create a system that broadcasts race track results for a crime boss.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: A wealthy Hawaiian pineapple plantation owner and bigoted bully with political ambitions flatly refuses to allow his young sister to marry a native.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: Gidget (1959)
programme.desc: Things turn around for a sad-faced teen who can’t measure up to the chesty, bikini babes on the beach when two surfers start paying her attention.

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: An aging New England mayor is defeated in a hard-fought reelection campaign involving shady transactions by both political groups.

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: The Undercover Man
programme.desc: Determined Treasury Department investigator Frank Warren (Glenn Ford) goes after a ruthless mobster known as The Big Fellow. When a key informant is murdered, Warren pursues the gangster on charges of tax evasion. But, with a slick mob lawyer hampering him at every turn, and threats being lobbed toward Warren's wife (Nina Foch), the lawman's chances of achieving a conviction are slim to none. His only hope is that one syndicate bookkeeper will have the courage to turn state's evidence.

programme.title: Sword of Sherwood Forest
programme.desc: After infiltrating a group of insurrectionists, Greene discovers their plan to murder the Archbishop of Canterbury and to take over Bawtry Castle.

programme.title: Eight Iron Men
programme.desc: In this psychological war drama, the nerves of eight men wear thin, as they are pinned down for 17 days under heavy bombardment during World War II.

programme.title: American Madness
programme.desc: During the Depression, the bank owned by generous Dickson (Walter Huston) is barely staying afloat, and things get worse when $100,000 is lifted from the vault. Fingers are pointed at reformed crook Matt (Pat O'Brien), who got a job and a fresh start from Dickson. The innocent Matt can clear his name by admitting that on the night of the robbery he was breaking up a tryst between Dickson's wife and another teller. But this revelation may crush Dickson, and Matt's conscience plays tug-of-war.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: Baby the Rain Must Fall
programme.desc: After his release from prison, an aspiring country singer tries to go straight, but his dream of a singing career puts this plan in danger.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: During World War II, a dilapidated vessel, the Caine, gets a new ensign, Willis Keith (Robert Francis), and a new captain, Commander Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). The crew sees Queeg's unconventional behavior as irrational, and communications officer Thomas Keefer (Fred MacMurray) spreads suspicion about his suitability as captain. When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: Two-Fisted Law
programme.desc: After Tim Clark's ranch is stolen by Bob Russell, he discovers that the crook is also trying to cheat his lover out of her land.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: The Untamed Breed
programme.desc: Texas ranchers resist an out-of-towner (Sonny Tufts) who has a Brahman bull to breed.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

programme.title: Bonanza Town
programme.desc: A Western that’s chock-full of action and fights as a cowboy tries to collar a group of outlaws while a crooked judge does all he can to stop him.

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: Kazan
programme.desc: A Canadian government wildlife expert (Stephan Dunne) tames a white dog trained to fight by brutal masters.

programme.title: Cyclone Fury
programme.desc: The Durango Kid puts the skids on a bandit bent on sabotaging an Indian's bid for a government contract.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run.
